nl_problem:
# Task: redundant_connection_ii
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: findRedundantDirectedConnection(self, arg1)

In this problem, a rooted tree is a directed graph such that, there is exactly one node (the root) for which all other nodes are descendants of this node, plus every node has exactly one parent, except for the root node which has no parents.
The given input is a directed graph that started as a rooted tree with n nodes (with distinct values from 1 to n), with one additional directed edge added. The added edge connects two different vertices chosen from 1 to n, and was not an edge that already existed.
The resulting graph is given as a 2D-array of edges. Each element of edges is a pair [ui, vi] that represents a directed edge connecting nodes ui and vi, where ui is a parent of child vi.
Return an edge that can be removed so that the resulting graph is a rooted tree of n nodes. If there are multiple answers, return the last occurrence in the given 2D-array.

Constraints:
- n == edges.length
- 3 <= n <= 1000
- edges[i].length == 2
- 1 <= ui, vi <= n
lisp_spec:
(task
  (name "findRedundantDirectedConnection")
  (signature
    ( (self Solution) (arg1 (list (list int int))) )
    (list (list int int)))
  (constraints
    (constraint "n == edges.length")
    (constraint "3 <= n <= 1000")
    (constraint "edges[i].length == 2")
    (constraint "1 <= ui, vi <= n")
  )
  (goal
    (description "Find an edge that can be removed so that the resulting graph is a rooted tree of n nodes.")
    (rule "Return the last occurrence in the given 2D-array if there are multiple answers.")
    (return "The edge that can be removed to make the graph a rooted tree.")
  )
)
